text: saying this here and now for posterity (and for fact checking in january): I think this xmas becomes the slow-burn start of Apple Watch and Android Wear as a broader market.
<@U026PHQ3J>: interesting prediction. More of a hunch or are you starting to see some trends?
hunch. there's nothing driving active adoption right now, but with so many manufacturers NEEDING to move product, I think we'll probably see ride-along discounts with mobile devices.

So basically, everyone will dump their 2015 models on unsuspecting dads, their kids will end up playing with them by April, tweaking the market for a desirous younger set who know that _something_ cool must be possible with them
end of 2016, we flood the market with lower-cost, higher functioning options
just in time for back to school, maybe
note: I think Samsung might win this race if this tips middle-aged rather than youth
I think you’re totally right - but only for apple watch
I also suspect that this might be the end of the line for the smart tracker space.
(don't tell adidas)
I think it’s the beginning of the end
i would love for this to be true… because i’d love to see a surge of clever apps for apple watch
I suspect that the smart-ish tracker will live on for at least another year simply based on price point
the indie crowd hasn’t invested in developing any great apps yet
<@U0914MEN7>: its not capable of anything much in its current form. The SDK is half-baked.
I think the adaption of iBeacon has to be a precursor to _widespread_ Apple watch adaption
ugh. that’s a bummer.
<@U026PHQ3J|evans> set the channel topic: FUTURISMDAY
I wonder (loudly) if the health fad is about to wane in general. It wouldn't be the first time.
Scenario: 2 teenagers shopping. 1 gets a discount pushed to watch, other doesn’t. That kind of exclusivity would drive adoption with the kids
<@U0B9N0HF0> clearly practical, but apple watch doesn't have fashion appeal to teens right now. Thats the mark they missed.
i think the health fad is shifting from quantification to common sense
<@U026PHQ3J>: the new pebble had swatch-appeal. the closest thing i saw to potential teen fast fashion
where is swatch in all this?!
The Apple Watch 1.0 industrial design to me is very analogous to iPhone 1.0
Or does the internet beats clock run out before 2015 so their tech team all left the planet
in the back of the drawer of every dresser from the 1980s
<@U026PHQ3J>: Im not sure I agree - I think fashion is trickier than that
Apple watch isn't noticeable enough. My gut tells me we're headed exactly back to swatch.
Early iMac era shit
I think the next watch will have a lot in common with 5c
oof
what a dog
:simple_smile:
or at least the one that leads wider adoption amongst the youth
IMO Swatch is sexy though
curious if smart watches are banned in high schools
<@U0260V4K1> I agree, but I also know that eventually we're headed back into "Le Bag" territory
beats headphones are basically this.
well - all things are cyclical, sure, but there have always been objects that are desirable because they are what they are
totally. in the context of the smartwatch, tho, i think the misfires are just that we're in the grey-brick era right now
we'll see the Sidekick of smartwatches next year
THEN we'll get the apple watch we actually want
I feel like this wants to be constructed into a bet of some kind
(maybe pebble is the Sidekick already)
ha. i just want to get bargain basement deals on a smartwatch in december
Im not sure how apple does a discount watch
they did. it was the sport version. :wink:
they don't have to!
they just have to do a better job at the watch they have
Maybe health care companies actually offer discounts to employees who wear watches and Apple strikes enterprise deals with large corporations to subsidize it?
<@U0B9N0HF0> you're thinking like a rational adult
amazon made that mistake
hahah
I just think they need to get the price point down to $199
iPhone 3G territory, not original iPhone territory
ok here's my other prediction (and this isn't much more than the obvious)
Google has project Fi which is a cell carrier-like layer over Sprint and T-Mo
Apple launches this too in 2016 with Verizon and ATT
(this explains why everyone is dumping 2 year contracts)
Apple wanted to run it’s own carrier since the beginning
Spent years trying to get everything in place and eventually going with at&t out of necessity. This makes a lot of sense
this deal leads to "cable" on Apple TV
(since ATT owns DTV)
you get TV on watch, you solve the market.
This also gives them enough time to get voice right on Apple TV
but specifically with smartwatches (and wearables) I think this xmas is the soil. it will not be the revolution
So you can eventually tell Siri “Put on the Steelers game"
way to pander to the steelers fan
:stuck_out_tongue:
Haha. Gotta contextualize for your audience :wink:
My “most likely unoriginal prediction” is that the Apple TV becomes the hub for HomeKit.
I'm still working on my thoughts regarding smart home.
The doubling of Bluetooth power enables sensors to be stuck anywhere in the home and to be easily paired with the “home” through the Apple TV
my prediction is that I actually buy an apple watch, then remember that I can’t type when I’m wearing a watch, then stop wearing it, then cry a little when I see a $400 dead watch on my night stand
ha
i keep eyeing up the round face android wear devices and talk myself out of them with exactly that story
The Moto 360 watch is _really_ bulky too
Feels awkward on the wrist. Apple at least got the feel part right
